title: Code Review Process

description.short: Catch bugs and share knowledge through effective code review
description.medium: Establish review workflows, learn what to look for, give and receive constructive feedback, and build a review culture that improves code quality without killing velocity
description.full: Code review is a quality gate where another developer examines code changes before they're merged. This covers pull request best practices, what to look for (correctness, design, security, performance, tests), giving and receiving effective feedback, automated checks, review metrics, and building psychological safety in code review culture. Good reviews catch bugs, share knowledge, and maintain standards.

why_it_matters: Catches bugs before they reach production
Creates opportunities for mentorship and learning

objectives: Learn the basics of giving respectful feedback
Know what makes a good vs bad pull request
key_takeaways: Be specific and kind in feedback
Small PRs (200-400 lines) get better reviews

objectives: Know what to look for in reviews (correctness, design, security, tests)
Write good PR descriptions and self-review
Set up automated checks to catch common issues
key_takeaways: Review for correctness, design, tests, security, performance, and style
Use questions ('Could we...?') instead of commands
Automated checks free reviewers for higher-level concerns

objectives: Build review culture with psychological safety
Use review metrics without gaming them
Scale code review across teams and time zones
key_takeaways: Review depth should match change risk
Tools (SonarQube, AI assistants) augment human review
Balance review rigor with team velocity

estimated_time_to_implement.surface: 1-2 days to establish basic PR workflow
estimated_time_to_implement.mid_depth: 2-4 weeks to build review culture and automated checks
estimated_time_to_implement.deep_water: 3-6 months to mature review processes at scale

common_mistakes: Personal criticism instead of code criticism
Reviewing 2000-line PRs (too large to review well)
success_metrics: Defects caught in review vs production
when_to_prioritize: Building production systems with multiple developers
